title: I am a new user and I search a lot to find this font.
author: nauman173

comments.content:
Hello  
Maybe LaurenScript Regular by DeNada Industries - Mike Allard  
Alex

Thanks  
Thank you so much  
WhatFontis

This design has also been revived in a commercial font [Adadge Script JF](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174423/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jawfonts/adage-script-jf/) by Jason Walcott, which is perhaps more polished. AFAIK Lauren Script was produced as an original work previous to Adage Script and thus is in no way a rip of Adadge script. No info on the pre-digital original. Perhaps a photo lettering era design?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174423im_/http:/typophile.com/files/AdageScript_5346.jpg)
  
Don

Mr. Walcott himself [tells us (see the About tab)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174423/http:/marketplace.veer.com/font/Adage-Script-JBT0000002?skeywords=adage&stermids=100005080#) that this is a revival of a "vintage photo-typesetting face. I'm going to look through the Filmotype catalog right now.

Mike Allard created some of the earliest digital shareware revivals. I don't believe he created any original designs - but I might be wrong.

Edit - It wasn't a Filmotype face.
